item.description:
This is a 34 Mile Ride, which starts on Back Roads, then we Visit Watch Hill & the Beaches of Southern R.I., before we head back.  The Route is Marked, so you faster Riders, can go at your own pace.  I also have Maps.  I will be going about 13 mph.  Last time I did this ride, I only used my Granny Gear Twice.  ( The first time, I am not sure if a really needed too.)

I have Biked the Beach Section several times, you will enjoy it.

 

Looking over those who signed-up on my other Meet-Up Site,  I see a few Faster Riders & Quite a few who ride at my pace. ( 13-14 mph).   There are some who I have never rode with, so I do not know where you fit in.  FYI: This is not a beginners ride.  You are more than welcome to ride, but if you can not keep-up with me, you are on your own. I offer a variety of rides, with different paces.  I am sorry, but I can not accommodate everyone or watch everyone.

 

The Route was marked, but it may be a little faded.  I have done this route twice & I have directions.  Some of you have also ridden  this route & I have a few from another Group, who have ridden this route.  The first 1/3 is basically a straight Route.  Then you go thru Watch Hill & Misquamicut Beaches.  The last 1/3 is heading back to your cars.   If you want directions, please send me an E-Mail & I will send them to you.

This is a Great Ride & I plan to ride it twice a Year.

Yes, we did this Ride in September.  This is a good Training Ride for those who have Charity Rides coming up in June.  FYI: I plan to do it again in September, God willing & the well don't run dry.  Did your Dad say that ??
item.how_to_find_us: Switch Road is in Richmond, R.I.
item.name: Bike Back Roads & Beaches of Southern R.I. a Perfect Training Ride
